segment.source: How to Apply General Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply General Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply General Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply General Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply General Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply General Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: The general settings enable you to configure the basic user experience when working with a MED-V workspace, by defining whether the MED-V workspace will appear in seamless integration or full desktop mode.
segment.target: The general settings enable you to configure the basic user experience when working with a MED-V workspace, by defining whether the MED-V workspace will appear in seamless integration or full desktop mode.

segment.source: Seamless integration includes legacy applications in the host desktop so that they appear as if they are installed directly on the host.
segment.target: Seamless integration includes legacy applications in the host desktop so that they appear as if they are installed directly on the host.

segment.source: Full desktop presents the desktop of the MED-V workspace operating system in a separate window on the host.
segment.target: Full desktop presents the desktop of the MED-V workspace operating system in a separate window on the host.

segment.source: All general settings are configured in the Policy module, on the General tab.
segment.target: All general settings are configured in the Policy module, on the General tab.

segment.source: To apply general settings to a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To apply general settings to a MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: Configure the general properties as described in the following table.
segment.target: Configure the general properties as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: General Workspace Properties
segment.target: General Workspace Properties

segment.source: Property Description Workspace Properties
segment.target: Property Description Workspace Properties

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: The name of the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The name of the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Do not rename an existing MED-V workspace while it is running on a client computer.
segment.target: Do not rename an existing MED-V workspace while it is running on a client computer.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Description of the MED-V workspace, which can include the content or status of the MED-V workspace and any other useful information.
segment.target: Description of the MED-V workspace, which can include the content or status of the MED-V workspace and any other useful information.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The description is for administrator use and has no impact on the policy.
segment.target: The description is for administrator use and has no impact on the policy.

segment.source: Support contact info
segment.target: Support contact info

segment.source: The contact information for technical support.
segment.target: The contact information for technical support.

segment.source: The information entered will be displayed in the support contact information screen that can be accessed from the MED-V client notification area.
segment.target: The information entered will be displayed in the support contact information screen that can be accessed from the MED-V client notification area.

segment.source: Workspace UI
segment.target: Workspace UI

segment.source: Seamless Integration
segment.target: Seamless Integration

segment.source: Select this option for the MED-V workspace windows, taskbar, and notification area icons to integrate seamlessly into the host desktop.
segment.target: Select this option for the MED-V workspace windows, taskbar, and notification area icons to integrate seamlessly into the host desktop.

segment.source: Draw a frame around each workspace window
segment.target: Draw a frame around each workspace window

segment.source: When using seamless integration, select this option to create a colored border around all applications running within the MED-V workspace and a colored background for all taskbar button icons.
segment.target: When using seamless integration, select this option to create a colored border around all applications running within the MED-V workspace and a colored background for all taskbar button icons.

segment.source: In the Frame color field, select the color.
segment.target: In the Frame color field, select the color.

segment.source: Full Desktop
segment.target: Full Desktop

segment.source: Select this option to display the MED-V workspace as the entire desktop, without integrating with the host.
segment.target: Select this option to display the MED-V workspace as the entire desktop, without integrating with the host.

segment.source: Host Verification
segment.target: Host Verification

segment.source: Command line
segment.target: Command line

segment.source: Type a command line to run on the host before starting the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Type a command line to run on the host before starting the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Do not start the Workspace if the verification fails (exit code is not '0')
segment.target: Do not start the Workspace if the verification fails (exit code is not '0')

segment.source: Select this check box if you are using a command line and want to start the MED-V workspace only if the script is completed successfully.
segment.target: Select this check box if you are using a command line and want to start the MED-V workspace only if the script is completed successfully.

segment.source: A command line can be run on the host prior to starting the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: A command line can be run on the host prior to starting the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: To run a command line before starting a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To run a command line before starting a MED-V workspace

segment.source: In the Command line field, enter a command line.
segment.target: In the Command line field, enter a command line.

segment.source: To start the MED-V workspace only if the command line was successful, select the Do not start the workspace if the verification fails check box.
segment.target: To start the MED-V workspace only if the command line was successful, select the Do not start the workspace if the verification fails check box.
